item.title: Borderlands 4 Gets Massive Early Black Friday Discount At Amazon
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon's Black Friday 2025 sale doesn't officially begin until November 20, but the online retailer is offering some stellar early video game deals for PS5, Xbox Series X, and Nintendo Switch 1/2. One of the most notable early discounts is Borderlands 4. Launched in September with a $70 retail price, Gearbox's long-awaited looter-shooter is up for grabs for $48 on PS5 and Xbox Series X.

Black Friday deals on games that aren't out yet are uncommon, but Amazon is also offering a big discount on the upcoming Nintendo Switch 2 port of Borderlands 4. The Switch 2 port doesn't have a release date, but you won't be charged until your preorder ships.

Borderlands 4 for PS5 / Xbox Series X

$48 (was $70)

While previous Borderlands games were primarily set on the planet of Pandora--Borderlands 3 expanded on this with several more planets to visit--Borderlands 4 takes place on the world of Kairos, giving players free rein to cause some chaos as they take on the forces of the Timekeeper.

Just like its predecessors, the key goal here is to take control of one of four unique Vault Hunters, grow their skills, and strengthen them further by finding powerful weapons and gear. It's a formula that has been present since the original Borderlands game, but in Borderlands 4, that gameplay has been fine-tuned to its best and enhanced with quality-of-life features.

  • PS5 -- $48 ($70)
  • Xbox Series X -- $48 ($70)

Borderlands 4 for Nintendo Switch 2

$55 (was $70) | Release Date TBA

The Nintendo Switch 2 port of Borderlands 4 was originally slated for October 3, just a few weeks after the game's September 1 launch on other platforms. But then about a week before launch day, Gearbox announced an indefinite delay to polish the experience on Switch 2.

If you're planning on buying Borderlands 4 for Nintendo Switch 2, it makes sense to secure a preorder right now. Amazon has slashed $15 from the price, so you can secure Borderlands 4 on Switch 2 for $55. Keep in mind this is a Game-Key Card, so you will need to download Borderlands 4 from the eShop after loading the cartridge into your console for the first time.

While previous Borderlands games were primarily set on the planet of Pandora--Borderlands 3 expanded on this with several more planets to visit--Borderlands 4 takes place on the world of Kairos, giving players free rein to cause some chaos as they take on the forces of the Timekeeper.

Just like its predecessors, the key goal here is to take control of one of four unique Vault Hunters, grow their skills, and strengthen them further by finding powerful weapons and gear. It's a formula that has been present since the original Borderlands game, but in Borderlands 4, that gameplay has been fine-tuned to its best and enhanced with quality-of-life features.

Since launch, developer Gearbox has further tweaked Borderlands 4 with several big updates, balance patches, and weekly hotfixes. The studio also has extensive post-launch plans for the game--both paid and free--with the first DLC dropping on November 20 and adding all-new missions, enemies and legendary gear.

Endgame content is also arriving toward the end of the year, as players will be able to test their skills and Vault Hunter builds against a tough boss called Bloomreaper the Invincible.

More Black Friday Video Game Deals

Borderlands 4 on Switch 2 isn't the only upcoming game in Amazon's early Black Friday sale. Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Splintered Fate's Pipin' Hot Collector's Edition is available to preorder for a $20 discount on PlayStation, Switch, and Xbox. Unlike Borderlands, we know when this one launches: December 5.

Nintendo players looking to pass the time before Borderlands 4 lands on Switch 2 should check out Amazon's deals on Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy and Red Dead Redemption. Both games are discounte to new all-time lows, and Red Dead is getting a free Switch 2 update December 2.

For more early Black Friday video game and hardware deals, check out the Amazon hubs below:

Amazon Gaming Deals:

  • PS5 Deals
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Deals
  • Nintendo Switch Deals

item.title: Lego Fortnite Peely Bone Discounted To Best Price Ever, Retiring Soon
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fortnite fans will want to check out Amazon's early Black Friday deal on Lego's Peely Bone building set before it disappears. Normally $100, Lego Fortnite: Peely Bone is available for only $80 at Amazon and Target. Not only is the 1,414-piece half-skeleton, half-banana on sale for its lowest price yet, but Lego is retiring this set soon. Peely Bone has largely held its MSRP since launching more than a year ago, so it's nice that Fortnite fans have the opportunity to grab it for less before it's no longer sold at major retailers. Amazon notes this limited-time deal is "selling fast."

Peely Bone is one of two Lego Fortnite sets from last October's launch lineup that will no longer be produced going forward. The 193-piece Durrr Burger is the other soon-to-be retired Lego Fortnite set. Amazon is all out of Durrr Burgers, but you can still snag one for only $9.40 (was $15) at Walmart or $9.49 at Target.

Lego Fortnite: Peely Bone (1,414 Pieces)

$80 (was $100)

Peely Bone is the largest Lego Fortnite model from last fall's launch lineup, and it was only recently surpassed by Mecha Team Leader. As shown in the image above, Peely Bone is packaged in a black box, meaning it's a display model designed for adults and experienced builders.

Peely Bone measures over 14 inches tall with the included, buildable display stand. A Lego Fortnite nameplate attaches to the front of the stand. Along with the figure and stand, you'll piece together impressively detailed replicas of the Peely Pick Pickaxe and Paint Launcher weapons as well as a detachable Banana Bag Back Bling. You can move Peely's arms and wrists to create different poses.

Outside of Mecha Team Leader--the only other black-box Fortnite set--the 1,414-piece Peely Bone model has the most complex build process. The half-skeleton, half-banana frame makes each side of the build a unique and rewarding process. It's one of the most interesting Lego figures/statues I've built over the past few years. Plus, the finished model looks fantastic. The newer Mecha Team Leader model is a fun and challenging project, but I still think Peely Bone is the best Lego Fortnite model yet. And one of the best licensed video game builds, period.

If you register Peely Bone or one of the other original four Fortnite sets to your Lego account, you will receive a code to unlock the Operation Brite Starter Pack in the video game. You can only get

More Lego Fortnite Early Black Friday Deals

Along with the deals on Peely Bone and Durrr Burger, a few other Lego Fortnite sets are on sale at Amazon, Walmart, and Target. Most notably, the 691-piece Supply Llama is discounted to $26 (was $40) at Target. Amazon was matching this deal but has since sold out. Over at Amazon, you can also save 20% on the 546-piece Durrr Burger Restaurant and 250-piece Peely & Sparkplug's Camp playsets.

If you're interested in the Lego Fortnite: Battle Bus, Walmart has a great Lego Fortnite 2-in-1 bundle deal featuring the 954-piece set with the Supply Llama for $110 (was $140).

  • Supply Llama (691 pieces) -- $26 ($40)
  • Supply Llama & Battle Bus Bundle (1,625 pieces) -- $110 ($140)
  • Durrr Burger (193 pieces) -- $9.40 ($15) | Retiring soon
  • Durrr Burger Restaurant (546 pieces) -- $52 ($65)
  • Peely & Sparkplugâ€™s Camp (250 pieces) -- $18.39 ($23)
  • Peely Bone (1,414 pieces) -- $80 ($100) | Retiring soon

Check out GameSpot's Lego Fortnite buying guide for an in-depth look at the full collection. And make sure to bookmark our Black Friday deals hub if you want to hear about more Black Friday Lego deals in the coming weeks.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption Switch Physical Edition Discounted Ahead Of Free Switch 2 Update
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Ahead of Red Dead Redemption's Nintendo Switch 2 update next month, Amazon is offering a discount on the recently rereleased physical edition for Switch. Rockstar Games distributed a new budget-friendly $30 edition in September, and now you can grab a copy of Red Dead Redemption for $25 during Amazon's early Black Friday video game sale.

Red Dead Redemption's physical edition for Switch includes the full game and Undead Nightmare expansion on the cartridge. The Switch 2 update will be available December 2, and it's free for owners of the Switch edition. The digital version still retails for $50, so you can save 50% by picking up the physical edition instead. Amazon's early Black Friday sale also includes the Switch port of Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy - The Definitive Edition for $20 (was $30).

Red Dead Redemption for Nintendo Switch

$25 (was $30)

Red Dead Redemption's Switch 2 update will offer 60fps as well as enhanced visuals with HDR and DLSS. Switch 2 players will also be able to play Red Dead Redemption with Joy-Con 2 mouse controls.

If you're buying RDR to play on the original Switch, you should know it's still a pretty impressive port from a technical perspective. It runs at a stable 30fps in handheld and docked modes with 720p and 1080p resolution, respectively.

Red Dead Redemption is a spaghetti western that nails the mythic appeal of being a cowboy. The game doesn't stray far from the open-world template that Rockstar perfected with its previous GTA releases. You have the freedom to explore, cause trouble, and complete quests provided by the large cast of memorable characters.

John Marston's journey across the sprawling expanses of the American Wild West and Mexico to bury his blood-stained past and protect his family is a memorable one.

Along with the base game, this edition of RDR comes with Undead Nightmare, a horror-themed adventure in which the world around you has been transformed into an apocalyptic landscape overrun with zombies. Undead Nightmare was originally released as a standalone expansion, but these days it's bundled with the base game on modern platforms.

Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy for Nintendo Switch

$20 (was $30)

If you also want to explore the city streets of the modern age, check out Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy - The Definitive Edition for only $20 (was $30). This collection still retails for $60 on the eShop, but Rockstar rereleased the physical version a few months back with a budget-friendly MSRP.

Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy collects three PS2-era classics: GTA 3, Vice City, and San Andreas. The Definitive Edition launched in rough shape, but all three games are much better these days thanks to multiple patches and a significant overhaul last fall.

When you pop in the game card for the first time, you will be prompted to download roughly GTA: Vice City from the eShop (roughly 9GB). San Andreas and GTA III are stored on the card. The digital version of the trilogy from the eShop, for reference, is 25.4GB.

Nintendo Switch 1/2 Early Black Friday Deals at Amazon

Along with deals on the pair of Rockstar Games titles, Amazon has deals on a bunch of other Switch and Switch 2 games. For more classics, check out Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver 1&2 Remastered and Tomb Raider IV-VI Remastered, both of which have nice Deluxe Editions with collectibles for $35 or less.
